## PathUtils.extname() method

Returns the extension of the path, including the leading dot.

Behavior: - Based on the result of `basename`<!-- -->. - If there is no dot, returns an empty string.

Examples: - extname('/a/b/c.txt') -<!-- -->&gt; '.txt' - extname('/a/b/c') -<!-- -->&gt; ''

**Signature:**

```typescript
static extname(path: string): string;
```

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

path


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

Input path.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string

The extension (e.g., ".txt") or an empty string if none.
